oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Oklahoma Roundup Rehearsal - 1946-08-10 - KOMA - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part two of a rehearsal from the Oklahoma Roundup radio program on August 10, 1946 on radio station KOMA (Oklahoma City, Okla). Staff includes Hiram Higsby (master of ceremonies, writer), Allan Page (announcer, director), and Kenyon Brown (producer).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Lem Hawkins; Homegrown Trio; Hiram Higsby; Mary Lou; Dick Reinhart; Chuck Davis
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (0:00) Lem Hawkins tells a joke [incomplete] / (1:20) Lem Hawkins performs "[Unidentified banjo tune]" / (2:22) Hiram Higsby and Allan Page tell a joke / (2:53) The Homegrown Trio performs "Heartbreak Trail" / (5:25) Hiram Higsby and Allan Page tell a joke / (6:21) Hiram Higsby and Lem Hawkins perform "He’s Got The Whole World In His Hands" / (8:22) Hiram Higsby and Allan Page tell a joke / (9:06) Mary Lou performs "I’m Branding My Darling With My Heart" / (11:11) Hiram Higsby introduces the next song / (11:17) Dick Reinhart and Mary Lou perform "How Beautiful Heaven Must Be" / (12:52) Chuck Davis performs the closing theme / (13:32) Closing statements
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Oklahoma Roundup; CBS Inc.; KOMA (Radio station : Oklahoma City, Okla.); Higsby, Hiram, 1909-1975; Reinhart, Dick; Davis, Chuck;
